abstract: More than 70,000 births during Ebola crisis in Liberia were never recorded, leaving them vulnerable to marginalization as noncitizens, denial of government services, trafficking and illegal adoption.
lead_paragraph: The births of more than 70,000 children in Liberia during the Ebola crisis were never recorded, leaving them vulnerable to marginalization.

headline.print_headline: Africa; Liberia: Ebola Stalls Birth Registrations

snippet: The births of more than 70,000 children in Liberia during the Ebola crisis were never recorded, leaving them vulnerable to marginalization.
